yabel.code
Class Code

java.lang.Object
  yabel.attributes.Attribute
      yabel.code.Code

public class Code
extends Attribute

A Code attribute for a method. No support for LineNumberTable nor LocalVariableTable attributes.

Author:
Simon Greatrix

compile

public void compile(java.lang.String raw,
                    ClassData cd)

Compile some byte code instructions. The byte code is specified as white space separated mnemonics. Code can also be generated using the supplied ClassData and these special tokens:

Token Meaning
{property} Look up the String "property" in the ClassData and compile that
token:{property} Look up the String "property" in the ClassData and use that as the argument for the token. This is done recursively until the argument is not enclosed in {}s.
class:property
class:java/lang/String		 Generates a U2 value reference to a class constant in the constant pool for the specified class. The class is either the indicated String in the ClassData, or explicit.
iconst:property
iconst:456		 Generate an appropriate ICONST, BIPUSH, SIPUSH, LDC, or LDC_W statement to specify the indicated integer constant. The constant is either specified as an integer in the ClassData, or explicit
number:property Generate an U2 value reference to a numeric constant in the constant pool. The value must be in the indicated property of the ClassData.
field:property
field:myLocalField		 Generate an U2 value reference to a class field. The property can be either a String, indicating an already defined in this class, or a three element StringArray giving class, name and type in class file format. Alternatively it can simply be the explicit name of an already defined field in this class.
putField:property
putField:myLocalField
getField:property
getField:myLocalField
putStatic:property
putStatic:myLocalField
getStatic:property
getStatic:myLocalField		 Generate the appropriate instruction to access the specified field. Specification is as for field:.
invokeInterface:property
interfaceMethod:property		 Generates an INVOKEINTERFACE instruction or the U2 referent to the method definition in the constant pool. The property must be a three element StringArray specifying interface, name, and type.
@:property Defines a marker at this position. Each marker can only be defined once.
#:property Replaced with a U2 value indicating the location of the marker relative to the preceeding instruction. This can be used to implement IFs, GOTOs and JSRs like this: IFEQ #else {handleTrue} GOTO #endOfIf @else {handleFalse} @endOfIf
#4:property Replaced with a U4 value indicating the location of the marker relative to the preceeding instruction. This can be used to implement GOTO_W, JSR_W, TABLESWITCH and LOOKUPSWITCH
LDC:property Generates an LDC or LDC_W instruction to refer to the given constant in the constant pool. The ClassData must contain a value for "property" which is either a String or a Number.
ALOAD:property
ALOAD:12
DLOAD:property
DLOAD:12
FLOAD:property
FLOAD:12
ILOAD:property
ILOAD:12
LLOAD:property
LLOAD:12		 Generates an appropriate load or wide load instruction. The ClassData should contain an Integer for "property".
ASTORE:property
ASTORE:12
DSTORE:property
DSTORE:12
FSTORE:property
FSTORE:12
ISTORE:property
ISTORE:12
LSTORE:property
LSTORE:12		 Generates an appropriate store or wide store instruction. The ClassData should contain an Integer for "property".
IINC:property
IINC:12:34
IINC:varProp:34
IINC:12:constProp
IINC:varProp:constProp		 Generates an appropriate iinc or wide iinc instruction. The ClassData should contain a two element Integer Array for "property", or an integer for "varProp" and for "constProp".
RET:property
RET:12		 Generates an appropriate ret or wide ret instruction. The ClassData should contain an Integer for "property".
method:property
method:123
invokeSpecial:property
invokeSpecial:123
invokeVirtual:property
invokeVirtual:123
invokeStatic:property
invokeStatic:123		 Generates an U2 reference, INVOKESPECIAL, INVOKEVIRTUAL or INVOKESTATIC instruction. The ClassData's "property" should contain either a two element StringArray specifying name and type of a method in this class, or a three element String Array specifying class, name and type of the method, or an Integer giving the index of the method definition in the constant pool. If an explicit value is given, it is the constant pool index.
U1:property
U1:123		 Outputs a single byte, either the specified integer in the ClassData or the explicit value
U2:property
U2:1234		 Outputs an U2 pair of bytes, either the specified integer in the ClassData or the explicit value
S4:property
S4:123		 Outputs a signed four byte value, either the specified integer in the ClassData or the explicit value

All the mnemonics and tokens are case insensitive, but the ClassData properties are case sensitive.

Parameters:
raw - byte code
cd - ClassData value substitutions

decompile

public ClassData decompile()
Decompile the code block.

Returns:
representation of the decompiled code.

getCode

public byte[] getCode()
Get the byte-code associated with this method. Note that once this has been called the byte-code is fixed unless a reset() is performed.

Returns:
the byte-code

getHandlers

public Handler[] getHandlers()
Get the exception handlers associated with this Code block.

Returns:
the exception handlers

getMaxLocals

public int getMaxLocals()

getMaxStack

public int getMaxStack()

reset

public void reset()
Reset this code block to completely empty. Note that any constants associated with the previous code wil not be removed from the constant pool.
